title: New satellite to show how AI advances Earth observation
summary: Artificial intelligence technologies have achieved remarkable successes and continue to show their value as backbones in scientific research and real-world applications.

title: Ground equipment issue scrubs Firefly’s 5th Alpha launch of 8 CubeSats for NASA
summary: Firefly made two launch attempts on Monday night, but had to ultimately scrub the mission due to a "ground support issue." Liftoff from Space Launch Complex 2 (SLC-2) at Vandenberg Space Force Base is set for no earlier than July 2 at 9:03 p.m. PDT (12:03 a.m. EDT, 0403 UTC on July 3).

title: SpaceX continues record-breaking year with Starship’s full success and Falcon milestones
summary: SpaceX continues to break records with its Falcon rockets during 2024 completing to date a total of 67 missions so far and putting the company on track to complete 135 launches by the end of it. SpaceX also unveiled a new extravehicular activity suit, completed several missions for the US and foreign governments, as well as started operational deployment of Starlink Direct to Cell and Starshield satellites.

title: Europe’s space funding gap threatens industry potential
summary: Europe must improve how it allocates capital for the space industry to avoid missing out on the fruits of rising early-stage investments, the head of Luxembourg-based private equity firm NewSpace Capital has warned.

title: Sols 4229-4231: More Analyses of the Mammoth Lakes 2 Sample!
summary: Earth Planning Date: Friday, June 28, 2024 After reviewing results from the Evolved Gas Analysis (EGA) experiment that were downlinked yesterday afternoon (Sols 4226-4228: A Powerful Balancing Act), the SAM team decided they’d like to go ahead with a second experiment to analyze the Mammoth Lakes 2 drilled sample. This experiment is known as the […]

title: NASA’s NEOWISE Infrared Heritage Will Live On
summary: NASA’s near-Earth-object-hunting mission NEOWISE is nearing its conclusion. But its work will carry on with NASA’s next-generation infrared mission: NEO Surveyor. After more than 14 successful years in space, NASA’s NEOWISE (Near-Earth Object Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer) mission will end on July 31. But while the mission draws to a close, another is taking shape, […]

title: Cassini Sees Saturn
summary: The Cassini-Huygens spacecraft captured this last “eyeful” of Saturn and its rings on March 27, 2004, as it continued its way to orbit insertion. This natural color image shows the color variations between atmospheric bands and features in the southern hemisphere of Saturn, subtle color differences across the planet’s middle B ring, as well as […]

title: Firefly set to launch Alpha on Noise of Summer mission
summary: After six months of preparation following its last flight, Firefly is ready to launch the Alpha rocket on its fifth mission no earlier than Tuesday, July 2, at 9:03 AM PDT (16:03 UTC). This mission, named Noise of Summer, is to launch eight CubeSats to a Sun Synchronous Orbit (SSO) from Space Launch Complex-2W (SLC-2W) at Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB) in California. The live stream for Firefly’s fifth launch is in collaboration with NSF. It starts at 8:33 AM PDT (15:33 UTC) and will be available on the NASASpaceflight YouTube channel.

title: NASA’s Upgraded Hyperwall Offers Improved Data Visualization
summary: In May, the NASA Advanced Supercomputing (NAS) facility, located at NASA’s Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley, celebrated the newest generation of its hyperwall system, a wall of LCD screens that display supercomputer-scale visualizations of the very large datasets produced by NASA supercomputers and instruments.  The upgrade is the fourth generation of hyperwall clusters […]

title: H3 Launches ALOS-4 Earth Observation Satellite
summary: On July 1st, 2024 at 11:06:46 PM Eastern Time Japan successfully launched its third H3 rocket, deploying the ALOS-4 satellite.
